Vietnam Adventure Tour 19 Days

$999.00 $899.00

Vietnam is a country equally as fascinating in geographical diversity as its cultural diversity, there are many ethnic groups inhabiting the different regions that stretch from the northern mountains bordering China to the lush, fertile lands of the south that reach far into the south pacific.

[skype-status skype_id=”vilandtravel” user_name=”Steve ” button_function=”call, chat” use_voicemail=”off” use_getskype=”off”]

Vietnam Tourism is filled with various kinds of geographical terraces (mountains, beaches, rice fields, and highlands) that are for ecotourism, beach holiday, adventure tours and home-stay experiences. The perfect combination between natural beauty and old historical sites makes Vietnam one of the more popular tourist counties in Asia. To ensure you get the most out of your stay in Vietnam we have organized for all these popular destinations for you cover. Such as, Hanoi, Sapa, Halong Bay, Hoi An, Nha Trang, Ho Chi Minh city and many more off beaten tracks!

We’ll start our journey from the North; we will then make our way all the way down to the south passing through some of the most beautiful views along the coast.

Categories: Adventure Tours, Backpacker Tours, Vietnam Tours

We’ll start our journey from the North; we will then make our way all the way down to the south passing through some of the most beautiful views along the coast.

Day 1: Hanoi arrival
Day 2: Hanoi food tour old quarter – Night bus to Sapa (B, L) group tour
Day 3: Sapa – Lao Chai Ta Van villages (B, L, D) group tour
Day 4: Giang Ta Chai – Su Pan Villages – Day bus to Hanoi (B, L) group tour
Day 5: Hanoi – Halong bay (B, L, D) group tour
Day 6: Halong bay (B, L, D) group tour
Day 7: Halong bay – Hanoi (B, L) group tour
Day 8: Hanoi – Bai Dinh – Trang An – Night bus to Phong Nha (B, L)
Day 9: Phong Nha and Paradise caves (L) Group tour
Day 10: Bus Phong Nha to Hue – Motorbike tour Hue to Hoi An (B) – Group tour
Day 11: Hoi An cooking class (L) Group tour
Day 12: Hoi An -take sleeping bus to Nha Trang (B)
Day 13: Nha Trang – Free & Easy
Day 14: Nha Trang snorkeling (B, L) Group tour
Day 15: Nha Trang-Da Lat (B)
Day 16: Dalat canyoning or hiking and biking (B) Group tour
Day 17: Dalat – Saigon (B)
Day 18: Saigon city – Cu Chi tunnels tour (B, L) Group tour
Day 19: Saigon- International flight (B)

Note: B: Breakfast, L: lunch, D: dinner

Included:
Accommodation: hotel in Hanoi, Phong Nha, Ho Chi Minh,
01 night on Party cruise;
1 night dorm on island in Ha Long bay;
Homestay in Sapa & Hoi An
Transfer by tourist bus : Hanoi – Sapa – Hanoi – Phong Nha – Hue; Hoi An – Nha Trang – Da Lat – Saigon
Motorbike tour Hue – Hoi An
Pick up at the airport
Meals as indicated (B=Breakfast, L=Lunch, D=Dinner)
Cooking class in Hoi An
English speaking Guide
Entrance tickets
Vietnam visa on arrival(approval letter)

Exclude:
Travel insurance
Drinks, meals, laundry, telephone and other private services.
Visa stamp fee 25US$/person

Vietnam is a country equally as fascinating in geographical diversity as its cultural diversity, there are many ethnic groups inhabiting the different regions that stretch from the northern mountains bordering China to the lush, fertile lands of the south that reach far into the south pacific.

Vietnam Tourism is filled with various kinds of geographical terraces (mountains, beaches, rice fields, and highlands) that are for ecotourism, beach holiday, adventure tours and home-stay experiences. The perfect combination between natural beauty and old historical sites makes Vietnam one of the more popular tourist counties in Asia. To ensure you get the most out of your stay in Vietnam we have organized for all these popular destinations for you cover. Such as, Hanoi, Sapa, Halong Bay, Hoi An, Nha Trang, Ho Chi Minh city and many more off beaten tracks!

We’ll start our journey from the North; we will then make our way all the way down to the south passing through some of the most beautiful views along the coast.

Day 1: Hanoi arrival (only driver)
Our car will pick you up at the airport and take you to hotel.
Overnight at hotel 2* in Hanoi.

Day 2: Hanoi food tour old quarter – Night bus to Sapa (L) group tour
Group size: max 5 people/ group
Have breakfast at hotel. Check out your room at 10.30am.

At 11am, your tour guide meets you at hotel; we start our walking street food tour. Your English speaking guide will not only walk you through the world of Hanoi’s street food but will also inform you of some of Hanoi’s delightful and interesting architecture along the way. You will eat as you walk, sampling seasonal fruits, and some French inspired foods from various food stalls.

The tour will finish at around 3pm and you will have all afternoon to relax or do some shopping. The bus will pick you up at your hotel at 9pm. Overnight on sleeping tourist bus.

Day 3: Sapa – Lao Chai Ta Van villages (B, L, D) group tour
Group size: max 8 people/ group

The bus will arrive in Sapa at around 4 am. However, you can stay on the bus till 6am. The Tour guide will meet you and transfer you to the hotel for breakfast and a quick shower. You can leave your luggage in the luggage storage room to prepare for your trek. You will only need to bring a change of clothing, trekking gear and toiletries for your stay at the village homestay. At 9am you will begin your 12 km trek on small trails down the Muong Hoa Valley towards the Black Hmong village of Lao Chai. The Muong Hoa Valley contains some of the most beautiful views of rice paddy fields in Asia.  After having lunch along the Muong Hoa river in Lao Chai, you will continue along the bottom of the valley to get to the Dzay tribe village of Ta Van to experience their way of life while staying in a local family’s cottage.

Overnight at homestay in Sapa

Day 4: Giang Ta Chai – Su Pan Villages – Day bus to Hanoi (B, L) group tour
Group size: max 8 people/ group
After breakfast, continue on 14 km of trekking to visit 2 villages of the red Dzao, the Hmong of Giang Ta Chai and Hmong, Dzao village of Su Pan.

On the way we drop by a beautiful waterfall and rattan bridge. Trek to Su Pan village through the bamboo forest to the main road to catch the car ride back Sapa. Take a day bus to Hanoi at 3pm. You will arrive in Hanoi at around 9pm.

Overnight at hotel 2* in Hanoi

Day 5: Hanoi – Halong bay (B, L, D) group tour
8.00 – 8.30: Pick up at your hotel in the Old Quarter of Hanoi where we collect most of new friends. You will arrive at the Harbor in Halong at around 12.30pm where you will board a Vietnamese-style Junk boat. The boat will cruise around the hundreds of islets whilst you relax or drink on with your new friends. Activities include Kayaking, swimming and boat jumping. There is also a Bar on the boat that will not close until you go to sleep, so you can go as hard or as crazy as you want!

Overnight on boat sharing room (2 people in 1 room).

Day 6: Halong bay (B, L, D) group tour

Breakfast will be served at 7.30am before checking out of your en-suite rooms at 9am. You will then make your way to Freedom Island. Before reaching the island, the boat will stop by a 12 meter rock, where you can climb and jump off! Or if you’re not feeling too adventurous, then you could just swim in the blue emerald waters of Lan Ha Bay. Once you’ve reached Freedom Island, you’ll check into your accommodation and you’ll have plenty of free time to relax, play volleyball or go Kayaking again. There are plenty of Hammocks and floating mattresses too!

Overnight at dorm on Freedom island.

Day 7: Halong bay – Hanoi (B, L) group tour
Breakfast will be served at 7.15am and you will spend the day making your way back to Hanoi. A cooking demonstration will be shown at 10am; we will learn how to make a very famous Vietnamese cuisine just before lunch. Lunch will also be served on the boat. You will arrive in Hanoi at 5pm where you’ll have a free afternoon to relax.

Overnight at hotel 2* in Hanoi.

Day 8: Hanoi- – Trang An – Night bus to Phong Nha (B, L)
8.00 – 8.30 AM: Our guide will pick you up at your hotel to make your way to Ninh Binh city. Here we will visit the Bai Dinh Pagoda and Trang An river caves, around 98 kms from Hanoi.

10.30 – 12 AM: Our guide and driver will take you to Bai Dinh Pagoda, the largest pagoda complex in Vietnam with more than 500 La Han statues, including a large spectacular bronze Buddha standing 10 meters tall.

12.30- 14.00: Lunch in local restaurant with local dishes (Goat, pork)

14.30: Continue on to visit Trang An. A scenic landscape complex nearby which recently has been recognized as an UNESCO World natural heritage site. Get on a rowing boat to travel along the small river with scenic mountains, caves and green fields.

17:00: After the tour, we make our way back to Ninh Binh town, where you will have free time to eat and prepare yourselves for a night bus to Phong Nha National Park.

20:00: Night Bus to Phong Nha

Overnight on sleeping bus.

Day 9: Phong Nha and Paradise caves (L) Group tour
Arrival at Phong Nha at around 5am.

8am, pick you up at bus office in Phong Nha, you will explore the impressive Phong Nha caves (50 km about the city, 45 minutes driving). After 25 minutes on a boat, you’ll arrive at the Phong Nha cave; take a couple hours to see the cave. This cave is famous for its rock formation which has been given names such as the “Lion”, the “Fairy Caves”, the “Royal Court”, and the “Buddha”.

12:00 Lunch at local restaurant in Phong Nha village

13:00 Visit Paradise cave – This remarkable cave system extends for 31kms, though most people only visit the first kilometer. The scale is breathtaking, as wooden staircases descend into a cathedral-like space with colossal stalagmites and glimmering stalactites.

17:30 Back to Phong Nha

Overnight at hotel 2* in Phong Nha.

Day 10: Bus to Hue – Motorbike tour from Hue to Hoi An (B) Group tour
Take the bus from Phong Nha to Hue. At 8am the guide will meet you at the bus office in Hue. This Scenic Coast route is simply the best way to travel to Hoi An if you only have one day! Leaving Hue in the morning our first stop is Elephant Springs where you can wade in the rock pools.

Next we stop for some photos at Lang Co Beach before traveling over the Hai Van Pass. Hai Van means “Sea of Clouds” and when crossing the top of the Pass you are literally surrounded by clouds on one side with stunning ocean views on the other.

Next we travel through Danang to a stop at the famous China Beach with its fine white sand. Don’t worry about your luggage as our bikes are equipped to carry it.  But if you are traveling with hard suitcases or a large number of bags we can easily arrange for them to meet you in Hoi An.

Overnight at home-stay in Hoi An.

Day 11: Hoi An cooking class (B, L) Group tour
8.30 am, pick up at your hotel. A trip to the market in the morning to buy some freshly grown local herbs. Then we board our river boat for a relaxing 40 minute ride to Thuan Tinh Island, which is recognized by Hoi An as an official ecological zone.

To visit the Local Village, we take a round row boat ride through the water coconut trees. We then walk through the gardens to visit Ms. Hoa’s house to meet her family and snack on grilled rice cakes and iced tea. From there, we head back to our open-air cooking class overlooking the water coconut trees and river. Our chefs will show you how to make Vietnamese food while you enjoy the cool breeze in a very peaceful setting.

Our chefs have prepared a 4 course cooking class of traditional Vietnamese dishes. They will demonstrate how to prepare them, and then it’s your turn to prepare your own tasty Vietnamese lunch!!

Free afternoon.

Overnight at home-stay in Hoi An

Day 12: Hoi An -take sleeping bus to Nha Trang (B)
Free time.
Take the sleeping bus from Hoi An to Nha Trang.
6.00pm, be ready at your hotel.
Departure time: 6.30pm, arrival time: 6am.
Overnight on sleeping bus

Day 13: Nha Trang – Free & Easy
Have free time.
Suggestion: Mud bath or Vinpearl Water park.
Overnight at hotel 2* in Nha Trang.

Day 14: Nha Trang snorkeling (B, L) Group tour
Nha Trang Bay is recognized as one of 29 the most beautiful Bays in the world. If you’ve never had the opportunity to visit this Bay, this cruise is the best chance for you.

Pick up at hotel at 8:00am. Today, we’ll be visiting 4 different islands. The first point is Hon Mun island, where you will have the opportunity to swim and snorkel in the most beautiful coral reefs in Vietnam.  Free snorkeling equipment is provided. We then continue to Hon Mot, during the boat ride, there will be lunch, entertainment, and activities with the guides and ship staff. Then you will jump in the water to participate in the floating bar. Next destination is Hon Tam.  We will stop here to swim sunbath or buy souvenirs before we head to the floating fishing village to see the daily activities of the local fishermen. We will return to the pier around 3:30 PM.

Overnight at hotel 2* in Nha Trang.

Day 15: Nha Trang-Da Lat (B)
Take the bus to Dalat.
Be ready at 7am at your hotel.
Departure time: 7.30 am.
Arrival time: 1pm.
Free time.
Overnight at hotel 2* in Dalat

Day 16: Dalat canyoning or hiking and biking (B) Group tour
Option 1: Dalat canyoning

Depart at your hotel in Dalat; we take you along picturesque road to the South of the city, head the Datanla waterfall. Stop at Gathering point, you will learn the basics of knot tying, harness wearing and abseiling techniques to begin conquering the 10km adventure activities deep in the jungle.

Station 1 – Dry cliff at 18m
This is the first activity after we mastered the skills to rappel down the steep cliffs.

Station 2 – Water sliding
By the time the stones have been eroded by the water, creating ideal venue for us to water slide down into rapid water. Gently lean over, hands keep the shoulders take a deep breath and slip down this a natural waterslide.

Station 3 – Waterfall Jump
This is a real challenge for you to take jumps from 7m and 11m cliff into a deep lake. Do not hesitate; be strong, nothing can stop your steps. It would be a major change in thinking when you accomplishing.

Station 4 – “Washing Machine”
You will abseil down until your back touches the waterfall, take a deep breath to increase hot blood up to your brain, straight the legs, wide eyes and relax your body. It will spin you around, clean your body and push you out of the falls before hiking up to the highway and meet our vehicle for transport back to town to end tour.

Option 2: Hiking and biking to Langbian
Depart at our office, we cycle about 12km on a picturesque road through flower and vegetable farms down to the foot of the Langbian mountain.

After parking our bikes there, we’ll climb up to one of the highest mountains in the south of Vietnam (Langbian peak: 2167 meters), this awesome challenge not only tests your legs but also your knees when you descend and ascend from hill to hill, you’ll see how the eco-system changes from forest to broad-leaf jungle, have chances to watch some precious animals around the area.

On your way back to Da Lat, we’ll cycle to the Lat village to know about the ethnic minority people’s handicraft and their lives. We will always provide stunning photo opportunities to remind you of probably the best day in Viet Nam.

Overnight at hotel 2* in Dalat.

Day 17: Dalat – Saigon (B)
Take bus from Dalat to Saigon
Be ready at your hotel at 6.30am.
Departure time: 7.00 am
Arrival time: 3 pm
From here, you take taxi to your hotel.
Free time.
Overnight at hotel 2* in Ho Chi Minh city.

Day 18: Saigon city – Cu Chi tunnels tour (B, L) Group tour
We start the trip by visiting Notre Dame Cathedral, the historic Central Post Office, followed by exploring the Reunification Palace, and the remarkable site of the War Remnants Museum.

After lunch, depart to Cu Chi Tunnels. Located 60km from HCMC, Cu Chi is now a popular spot for both Vietnamese & foreign tourists – the network of over 200km of tunnels became legendary when they played a vital role in the War. In their heyday, the tunnels were functioning underground cities including numerous trap doors, specially constructed living areas, storage facilities, weapons factories, field hospitals, command centers & kitchens.

Today, ducks and water buffalos happily co-exist in the rivers along the side of the road. However, the peaceful rural rice paddy scenery belies the area’s violent history. Visitors will find it hard to imagine the destruction, damage & defoliation over this whole area, caused by bombing and mines. There is plenty of evidence of the fierce battle that took place here during the 1960s when Cu Chi was a “Free Target Zone”.

Overnight at hotel 2* in Ho Chi Minh city.

Day 19: Saigon- International flight (B)
You will be free until our car transfer to airport to take flight back home.
End Tour.

Please fill in the form below with your details so we can personalize the tour to your needs and give you a quotation. We look forward to receiving your travel request.

How do I book and pay for a tour ?

Once you have found a tour that you would like to book, please fill in your booking details (the departure date that you would like to go, the package, the number of people, your full name, nationality, email address and any special requests). Once we confirm the availability, we will send you an email to confirm and our payment policy information. With this, you can choose your preferred payment method and pay us.

With tour bookings, you DO NOT need to pay total in advance, we just need 30% for Deposit, to ensure that you use our services. With flight or train ticket bookings, we require 100% total payment in advance. If you would like to pay by others methods, please inquire with us directly.

What if I need to cancel or change my itinerary ?

We allow you to change your dates, if needed, at no additional cost as long as you give sufficient advance notice and availability exists.
Cancellations of the tours usually involve a cancellation fee, which depends on how far in advance that you cancel. For each tour, the cancellation and change policies depend on the status of services providing. Please inquire directly for the change or cancellation policy for any particular tour.

Do you offer longer or more customized tours ?

You can ask for longer tours or customize your favourite travels with any our tours. Tours on our site www.travelagencyvietnam.com are popular tours which can be changed or customized for your needs.

If you have questions about a particular tour or would like a longer or more customized tour, please contact us at booking@travelagencyvietnam.com, and our travel experts will help you find your best travel itinerary.

What if I have special needs for the tour ?

If you have special requirements – for example, if you have a large group or young children, or you have infants or the olds in your group, or if you are handicapped or have physical limitations, if you have special transportation needs, or if you are vegetarian or have other food allergies – please let us know, and we can work with both you and the service provider ( restaurant, hotels, transportation …) to ensure that we can meet your needs.

How can I book a hotel / resort room ?

Simply select the hotel in which you would like to stay (or email or call us with your requests and we will make recommendations). Once you have selected a hotel, proceed with “Select” and please fill out all customer and payment information, as well as any special requests. We will confirm the availability of the hotel, and send you payment details as with tour booking.

When do I need to pay for hotel / resort booking ?

All hotel/ resort reservations must be paid in advance and immediately after booking the hotel/resort. We cannot hold hotel/resort bookings without payment. Note that we accept payment through PayPal, then it’s easy for you to send us the Deposit, to hold your hotel/resort bookings. If you are paying by credit card online, your credit card will not be billed until after we confirm the availability of the hotel. You can pay us 30% Deposit in advance, then pay the rest 07 days before check-in date.

Can I make a reservation for someone else ?

Yes, you can make a reservation for someone else. Simply fill in the name of the guest for the booking and your contact details. You can also pay by cash, paypal or bank transfer for someone else. However, you cannot make a payment for someone else using credit card. The name on the credit card must match the name of the guest.

How do I know my reservation is confirmed ?

After you make an online booking, we will follow up with you to confirm availability and confirm the booking. Your reservation is not confirmed until you receive this follow-up email or fax.

I am not ready to book right now, what should I do ?

For flights, you can make a booking and then we can hold the booking for a limited period of time until you are ready to purchase and issue the ticket. When you make a booking, we will inform you of the amount of time until the ticket must be issued since this timeframe varies by airline.

For hotels, in order to make a booking and hold a room, you must confirm and pay immediately. Unfortunately, we cannot hold a hotel booking for you without payment.

For tours, as tours are related to hotels booking. We will need you 30% for Deposit. This amount is to cover our costs if you cancel the tour. Almost is for cancellation charges of hotels/resorts.

Can I make payment for someone else using a credit card ?

No, you cannot make a payment for someone else using credit card. The name on the credit card must match the name of the guest.
However, you can pay for someone else using bank transfer or through PayPal.

What currency your prices are in ?

All of the prices on our website are in US Dollar.

Do you accept credit card ?

Yes, We accept Mastercard, Visa Card and American Express.

How many payment methods do you offer and what are they ?

Now we offer 5 payment methods: Cash, Bank transfer, Credit card imprint, Secure PayPal online payment and payment through Western Union.

Do you have electronic air tickets ?

Very few of the airlines in Vietnam offer electronic ticket. If an electronic ticket is available, we will issue an electronic ticket instead of a paper ticket, unless a paper ticket is specifically requested by the customer. Electronic tickets will be emailed or faxed to the customer.

I just received my flight ticket and there is a problem with it. What should I do ?

Please contact the customer service team immediately. If your flight is less than 48 hours from the time that you receive the ticket, please contact a customer service representative directly by phone. If the flight is more than 48 hours from the time that you receive the ticket, please contact us by phone or email at booking@travelagencyvietnam.com.

What happens if I make an airline booking and then do not confirm or pay ?

When you make an airline booking, we can hold the booking for a limited period of time, which depends on the availability of the flight and the airline. If we have not received confirmation from you after two emails or faxes, we will automatically cancel the booking.

If you confirm the booking but arrange to issue and pay the ticket later, we will inform you of the deadline for payment. If you do not make payment before this deadline, the booking will be automatically cancelled.

Thank you so much for your support to Viland Travel!
